QueryText: Control measures of Root wilt disease in coconut
KccAns: Rogue out palms that are affected severely by root wilt and yield less than 10 nutspalmyearrplant with disease tolerant onesApply fertilizers for coconut palms in recommended dosesapply 50 kg cattle manure or green manure and 1 kg of lime  palm  year Magnesium may be supplied  500 g MgO per palm per year in the Onattukara region sandy soil and 100 g MgO in the remaining areas

QueryText: what are the symptoms of Root wilt disease
KccAns: Symptoms of root wilt are  Abnormal bending or ribbing of the leaflets flaccidity of the leaves general yellowing followed by marginal necrosis of the leafletsAbnormal shedding of buttons reduced leaves and crown gradual reduction in yield

Apply fertilizers for coconut palms in average management at the rate of 034 kg N 017 kg P2O5 and 068 kg K2O  palm  year in the form of urea rock phosphate and muriate of potash respectively For palms under good management fertilizers may be given  of 05 kg N 032 kg P2O5 and 12 kg K2O  palm  year 3 In addition to the above apply 50 kg cattle manure or green manure and 1 kg of lime  palm  year

QueryText: What are the causes of root wilt disease and give the recommended control measures
KccAns: Root wilt disease of coconut is caused by a micro organism called phytoplasma The disease is transmitted by lace bug Stephanities typicus and plant hopper Proutista moesta No definite control measure has been developed so far The bearing palms in the early and middle stages of the disease respond well for the management practices and the yield of those palms could be maintained at economic level by the adoption of

QueryText: Management of root wilt disease in coconut
KccAns: Recommended that remove severely affected coconut palms and seedlings from the fieldApply balanced fertilizer including organic manure and chemical fertilizersApply 1 - 2 kg of lime in JuneApply 05 - 1 kg of magnesium sulphate and 250 g of micronutrient mixture along with fertilizerEnsure proper irrigation and drainage facilitiesSpray Roger  Dimethoate 15 ml  liter in pots against pathogenic pests

QueryText: Asked about management of root wilt disease in coconut
KccAns: Recommended to apply organic manures cattle or green manure  50 kg per palm per year Apply lime at 1kg per palm per year at 2 weeks ahead of fertilizer aplication Apply Magnesium sulphate MgSO4  100 gram per plant per yearInitial stage of the disease spray the crown and drench the basin with 500 ppm tetracycline 5 ml10 liter of water In heavily disease affected tracts rougue out all severely affected uneconomic adult palms yielding less than 10 nuts per year and all diseased palms in the pre-bearing age and replant with disease tolerant like CGD varieties  high yielding hybrids like Chandrasankara and CGD X WCT

QueryText: Asked about the management of root wilt disease
KccAns: Suggested to add organic manures cattle or green manure  50 kg per palm per year lime: 1 kg per palm per year and MgO or MgSO4 Magnesite  Magnesium source: 100 gram per plant per year in Onattukara region: 500 gramInitial stage of the disease spray the crown and drench the basin with 500 ppm tetracycline 5 ml10 liter of water

QueryText: Asked about management of Root wilt disease in Coconut
KccAns: Root wilt disease can be controlled by imparting natural resistance and health to the palms through proper manuring and agronomic practices For vector control spray Dimethoate 15 ml per litre of waterRogue out palms that are affected severely by root wilt and yield less than 10 nuts  palm  yearReplant with disease tolerant material  high yielding hybrids Chandrasankara
